definitions.text: an interconnected system of things or people
examples: he owned a network of shops
retirement meant dropping out of a whole network of people who had been part of my life
tangled in a web of cloth

definitions.text: (broadcasting) a communication system consisting of a group of broadcasting stations that all transmit the same programs
examples: the networks compete to broadcast important sports events

definitions.text: an open fabric of string or rope or wire woven together at regular intervals
a system of intersecting lines or channels
(electronics) a system of interconnected electronic components or circuits
communicate with and within a group
examples: You have to network if you want to get a good job
